sub_title: Polystack Technologist - Cloud, DevOps, .NET, C#, Azure, Blazor, AI/ML, Blockchain - BEng (Hons) CEng MBCS CITP MIET
summary:
An accomplished technology leader with an extensive track record as a software engineer in both frontend desktop and web application development, and high throughput multithreaded real-time backend server development. Primary programming skillset includes C# 10, .NET 7, ASP.NET Core MVC, Blazor, SQL Server (T-SQL), JavaScript, TypeScript, React, Solidity, as well as previous experience in C++, PL/SQL, WPF.

I am an avid proponent and practitioner of DevOps and Agile methodologies (Scrum, Kanban, Scrumban), and tooling such as Azure DevOps and GitHub Actions to streamline development and build/release pipelines with CI/CD and test automation methodologies. I have led many small and large teams of engineers, testers, and technical architects, and have also had hybrid roles as a Scrum Master alongside of being a developer. I enjoy mentoring and leading both junior and senior technical team members, and guiding a team to delivery, while also keeping my technical skills fresh by constantly coding in new technologies.

I work autonomously and am passionately motivated to develop high quality software using SOLID principles and BDD/TDD to ensure secure, efficient, robust, extensible, maintainable, scalable, testable, and concise readable code. Depending on budget, scope, and user requirements, the aim is always to build software with clean design (typically DDD) that performs well under load, and to maximise uptime per business requirements.

I have a proven track record in investment banking writing efficient code in real-time systems within strict deadlines, and I am able to interact with the business and end users to understand and gather requirements for both product delivery and support, demonstrable by the various applications I have written for Tier 1 investment banks.

Qualifications: I have a degree in Electronic Engineering from the University of Nottingham, and two charterships (CITP and CEng) with the British Computer Society and Engineering Council.

As a family man with young children, I aspire to work in a company where I can leverage my technical and leadership skills over a long-term period and add sustainable value to the business. I work well under pressure, and am at a stage in my career where I may combine my past experience with contemporary technologies and concepts such as AI/ML, big data, blockchain technology, .NET and DevOps to lead and build a cutting edge project and make it an explosive success.

contributors.headline: Polystack Technologist - Cloud, DevOps, .NET, C#, Azure, Blazor, AI/ML, Blockchain - BEng (Hons) CEng MBCS CITP MIET
IT Consultant at PETROINEOS TRADING LIMITED

projects.title: PDC Margin
projects.description:
PDC Margin is a system for credit checking trades with high-risk clients prior to the trade being accepted.  The system consisted of a back-end (C++) that performed the credit checking itself and a front-end GUI (a WPF XBAP application) that provided the reporting and workflow interface.  I solely worked on the front-end.  The front-end also consisted of a WCF service layer using the CSLA .NET Framework in order to communicate with the back-end (a SQL database and other back-end services).

For PDC Margin to interface with the back-end, I had to write a service layer component using WCF based on an in-house implementation of a third-party framework called CSLA .NET.  I faced many technical challenges implementing this and had to learn and understand some of the security and data restrictions in WCF to tackle issues such as user credentials being passed from the front-end (client-side) to the service layer (server-side).  There were also size limitations that were causing problems due to some of the data being transferred from the back-end to the front-end such as margin trade data which I had to resolve and understand the implications of.  Interoperability of the WCF component with the back-end services proved challenging due to the use of interop components to interact with C++ modules via DCOM.  Due to using different source control systems (Perforce and ClearCase) between these systems, DLL Hell was encountered and required substantial investigative work to determine how to resolve.

The system was ultimately delivered to the business on time and was received very well and continues to be used today.

contributors.headline: Polystack Technologist - Cloud, DevOps, .NET, C#, Azure, Blazor, AI/ML, Blockchain - BEng (Hons) CEng MBCS CITP MIET
Full Stack Windows and Realtime software developer and manager

authors.headline: Polystack Technologist - Cloud, DevOps, .NET, C#, Azure, Blazor, AI/ML, Blockchain - BEng (Hons) CEng MBCS CITP MIET

profile_positions.description:
- Engineering manager for both commercial and academic platforms across three opco subsidiaries in Netherlands, Sweden, and Belgium (Noordhoff, Liber, Plantyn).
- Manage five cross-functional engineering chapters and multiple product teams working across 11 products including several multitenant enterprise applications generating an 8-figure total turnover.
- Primary specialisms of the engineering teams include JavaScript, Angular, React, Node, PHP, .NET and C#, MySQL, SQL Server, Postgres, Docker, Azure DevOps, GitHub, Cypress, Kubernetes as well as concepts such as microservices architecture, DDD, CQRS.
- Collaborate regularly with peers in other strategic segments for determining architectural directives, company technical standards, and guiding principles for way of working and best practices.
- Mentor and educate engineering and support teams on Agile and DevOps best practices including SDLC process, tooling, IaC, CI/CD, containerisation (e.g., Dockerization), test automation, branching methodologies, coding standards, TDD, BDD, etc.
- Work closely and negotiate with product management to define and refine multiple backlogs while ensuring a healthy balance between timely deliverables, quality of code, and happiness of the team.
profile_positions.title: Principal Software Engineer

profile_positions.description:
- Built Ethereum smart contracts using Solidity, based on OpenZeppelin Contracts, and integrated with other decentralised services such as Snapshot, Gnosis Safe, Zodiac Reality Module and Reality.eth.
- Ensured project is a fully trustless DAO to instil confidence in the community and attract legitimate investment in an otherwise precarious technology space.
- Brokered partnership with animal sanctuary charity in Mexico with over 7m social media followers. Schnoodle donated over $300,000 in the first month of partnership; and continued to donate around $10,000 per day thereafter.
- Built unique and sustainable yield farming platform with a metaverse element known as Moon Farming.
- Built unique and sustainable NFT platform using 3D assets in glTF and GLB format persisted to IPFS.
- Built token bridge to connect multiple blockchains together such as Ethereum, Binance Smart Chain and Polygon.
- Built React frontend DApp with Node servers using Firebase for real-time data storage.
- Achieved over $300 million diluted market capitalisation in the first 3 months.
profile_positions.title: Founder | Chief Technology Officer

profile_positions.description:
- Lead developer of .NET Core team for corporate client websites using Umbraco CMS and Sitecore CMS.
- Championed the migration of projects from TFS 2015 to Azure DevOps including full use of branch policies, pull requests, build/release pipelines, and config transforms for fully automated CI/CD (continuous delivery).
- Introduced new unified Jira workflows in accordance with agile principles (allowing projects to follow Scrum or Kanban) to resolve recurring issues with code quality, refinement, estimation, and backlog prioritisation.
- Collaborated with developers to establish standardised C# coding conventions using SOLID and DRY principles.
- Implemented performance monitoring system for client websites using Elastic APM and Kibana including forking and making changes (accepted) to Elastic APM Agent on GitHub to support new requirements.
profile_positions.title: Lead Software Engineer

profile_positions.description:
- Backend C# and SQL Server development for reporting of front office trading activity to global regulators.
- Frontend JavaScript and ASP.NET MVC development for corporate loan credit assessment in risk and finance.
- Scrum Master for two Scrum teams working from single backlog.  Migrated TFS to Azure DevOps Services and streamlined process to leverage capabilities of Azure DevOps such as sprint planning, forecasting and capacity.
- Key member for Greenfield development team to add support for Murex (MxML) to existing solution including design and implementation.  This required a complete code restructure to be extensible for future inbound/outbound XML formats while maintaining backward compatibility with existing formats (FpML).
- Spearheaded a cross-team Kanban initiative to coordinate multiple project teams working on single codebase.
profile_positions.title: Senior Software Engineer | Scrum Master

profile_positions.description:
- Led a team of technical architects to introduce enterprise architecture within a fast-growing business including a proper source control workflow, continuous integration using TeamCity and a more robust development process from code reviews and unit testing through to deployment.
- Optimisation of T-SQL stored procedures to meet the demands of increasing volume in a fast-growing business.
- Backend development in C# and ASP.NET including implementation of new features for an online payment API as well as optimisation to improve the end-user experience for both merchants and merchants' customers.
- Major delivered project work included a feature to send card charge transactions to the merchant via webhooks asynchronously using MSMQ and a Windows Service with the option to encrypt using a public and private key.
- Managed the delivery of a new cloud infrastructure for all non-production environments to reduce ongoing operating costs for development, QA, pre-production, and sandbox.
- Helped the company through PCI compliance by engaging with the external audit process and assisting with ensuring sufficient and accurate evidence is in place, from software development and data storage to infrastructure and security.
profile_positions.title: Senior Technical Architect

profile_positions.description:
- Migration of risk model platform from legacy platform into new architecture for interest rates products.
- Server-side C# development to write new risk models for pricing of trades using greeks (gamma, vega, theta).
- Improved the performance of T-SQL stored procedures dealing with millions of trades by analysing execution plans and optimising the T-SQL queries.
- Became familiar with a complex architecture comprising numerous pricing systems to resolve issues and add new features. This involved considerable XML configuration which I streamlined using WPF tooling.
- Third-line development support for BAU (Business as Usual) team supporting production systems including live servers and databases, dealing with issues and outages in response to trading support requests.
profile_positions.title: Senior Software Engineer

profile_positions.description:
- Greenfield development of WPF application for CVA regulatory requirements.
- Rapid prototyping of client-server functionality to meet new and changing business requirements assisted by use of Scrum and active sprint planning.
- Actively used MEF for component composition and DevExpress controls to create an engaging interactive UI based on Metro UI of the Windows 8 platform.
- Implemented C# server-side nightly batch runner to load front office and risk analytics data from flat files comprising millions of trades and perform calculations then store results.
- Designed Oracle database and PL/SQL stored procedures for server interactivity for nightly batch runner, and for UI client to report results and allow workflow.
- Continually redesigned, refactored, and optimised code as requirements crystallised, to achieve high performance for processing large volumes of data in all stored procedures in the database, and C# code.
- Had to consider parallel processing wherever possible using Tasks namespace and PLINQ, and ensure optimal and robust database design.
- Unit testing and integration testing implemented using NUnit and Moq and ensured maximal coverage of all view models and server-side code.
- Implemented acceptance testing using FitNesse to achieve business buy-in.
- Configured build scripts using TeamCity; and used Subversion for source control.
profile_positions.title: Senior Software Engineer

profile_positions.description:
- Front office trader desktop application development for trading Euro Government bonds and interest rate swaps using WPF and .NET Framework 4.
- All WPF development used the Microsoft Prism framework to leverage MVVM design and dependency injection using Unity.
- Employed use of new technologies such as Reactive Extensions (Rx) and other modern .NET 4 technologies (such as the Parallel and Tasks namespaces).
- Wrote unit tests that ensured adequate code coverage and consistently passed in the automated build process.  Moq mocking library was used for unit testing.
- Coordinated deployment of assemblies from multiple dependent projects to test, QA, UAT and production environments following proper change management approval processes with due consideration for London, New York, and Tokyo market hours to ensure minimal disruption to traders.
- Became familiar with client trading gateways such as Bloomberg and Tradeweb.
- Managed time and tasks effectively working to strict deadlines for new features development while fixing defects in existing features to ensure a stable and smooth-running production environment.  Jira was used for task management.
- Regularly liaised with traders on the desk for support issues and development of new features and deal with production issues on a near daily basis.
profile_positions.title: Senior Software Engineer

profile_positions.description:
- Worked in the Credit Risk IT department as a .NET developer, primarily developing using WPF – a challenging, rewarding and enjoyable experience.
- All middle-tier requirements implemented with WCF and SOAP endpoints for data transport to the backend.
- Designed and developed a frontend XBAP in a .NET Framework 3.5 environment to provide a front office system to monitor high-risk margin clients’ collateral and exposure limits.  All backend interactivity was implemented using multithreading.
- Followed full SDLC employing agile methodology Scrum and was instrumental in ensuring successful progression through design, development, QA testing, UAT and delivery.
- Used third-party controls by Infragistics and Xceed to provide a rich user experience while learning the architecture behind WPF using XAML, C# and LINQ.
- Wrote and customised T-SQL stored procedures generated from CodeSmith templates for serving WCF service layer for standardised reporting and workflow purposes.
- Using leading-edge technologies where expertise was sparse required me to be highly resourceful in finding solutions to development challenges and become a local expert in the field of WPF and XBAP development.
- Maintained test software for simulating trades in a development environment pertaining to electronic trading and real-time Pre-Deal Checking (PDC) systems.
- PDC systems covered products such as options, forwards, spots, swaps, futures, and other foreign exchange derivatives allowing me to learn and understand these various trade types.
- Mentored junior team members towards leading-edge technologies such as C# and WPF.
- Managed time effectively to work to strict deadlines for developing new features while fixing defects in existing features to satisfy existing requirements of the business / end-users.
- Worked closely with Quantitative Analytics to devise and code pricing algorithms which gained me an appreciation of the underlying mechanics of the trade types I was developing for.
profile_positions.title: Senior Software Engineer

profile_positions.description:
- Substantial use of C# and Managed C++ within the .NET Framework 1.1 and 2.0 environments.
- Developed software to automatically parse ASN.1 specifications to generate ATL projects to provide COM API DLLs for encoding and decoding PDU binary data.
- Developed a C# WinForms GUI application for manipulation of XML data and XML Schema to use for validating binary data with the help of XSLT.
- Personally driven to follow object-oriented design when programming, using OOP design methodologies such as UML 2.0 and GoF design patterns.
- Nature of software use required all coding to be multithreaded and thread-safe to allow real-time processing without pitfall dangers like deadlocks and racing.
- Collaborated with other team members frequently to define interfaces between separate software modules (e.g., DLLs).
- Investigated use of P/Invoke, COM interop and C++ interop (IJW) to interact with existing COM API eventually settling for writing a Customisable Runtime Callable Wrapper (CRCW) using Managed C++ between C# and the COM API.
profile_positions.title: Software Engineer

volunteer_experiences.description: Supporting prostate cancer and testicular cancer initiatives, grew a mo during Movember and raised £101.

company.name: Age Concern Slough and Berkshire East

volunteer_experiences.description: Helped elderly people learn how to use computers at a computer drop-in centre in Guildford, Surrey.

GETTING AHEAD is a programme of employability skills conferences for Tower Hamlets secondary schools. Volunteers act as Group Advisers and work with small groups of students through several exercises.
